website_summaries.verdict: Overall, the feedback on the Adidas Leistung 16 II was mixed-to-positive. A significant number of training aficionados felt stable and in control when they exercised in the shoe. An elevated heel, excellent grip, a lockdown fit, and a wide, firm platform made it a solid choice for weightlifting. However, some detractors thought that the product was overpriced compared to similar models on the market.
pros: A significant number of reviewers noted that the Adidas Leistung 16 II offered excellent stability for weightlifting
The majority of wearers observed that the 25-mm heel height helped them improve ankle mobility and posture during squats
Most athletes stated that the BOA system worked well and provided a solid lockdown
A lot of purchasers found the design to be sleek
The grip of the shoe made some wearers feel as if they were glued to the floor
Several users appreciated the woven upper for its flexibility
cons: The shoe was a bit hot for several users
Some buyers considered it too expensive
A few athletes complained that the BOA system failed to deliver total tightness throughout the training session

customer_reviews.title: Saved my back deadlifting.
customer_reviews.text: I had always been on the edge about buying this style of shoe because I primarily do traditional weightlifting as opposed to Olympic lifting, I finally found this pair at a decent price so I figured I might as well give it a shot. These shoes are incredible in suprising areas, the primary benefit to me is to tilt my ankles forward while both squatting and deadlifting, which helps me sit much deeper into my seated position on both of these lifts without straining my hips, the benefit of this is a major reduction in lower back strain during both lifts due to enhanced leg mobility. Absolutely phenomenal, well worth the money even if you don't do Olympic style lifting.
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt Donesky

customer_reviews.title: Fits a wide foot. Time well tell about the tightening mechanism
customer_reviews.text: I'm a little weary of the tightening mechanism. People say that it starts to loosen during long workouts and may become an issue over the life of the shoe. I've lifted in them a couple times and appreciate the slightly higher than normal heel. The shoe isn't super stiff beyond the heel, so you can Olympic lift in them. It feels reasonably solit, but I still prefer the velcro strap to the fancy mechanism. I tend to wear a very wide show and my feet aren't terribly uncomfortable in them
customer_reviews.author: Temporary User Name

customer_reviews.title: Lifting in luxury
customer_reviews.text: I own four different weightlifting shoes. These are very comfortable, they also have a full inch of elevation for the heel, your squats are going to be easier than ever. The BOA system makes tightening very fast. Shoes go on or off quickly. I have wide feet, so these feel tighter in the toes than Nike or Nordic, because of my wide feet, I slightly prefer Romaleos 2.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Ehlers

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Theses shoes turned out to be incredibly comfortable and solid. I was a little skeptical at first based on the pics, but I've had snowboarding boots with boa lacing - which took a much bigger beating - and they never broke. If it seems like the shoe is so tight you can't get your foot in, chances are you need to loosen the boa. Pull the knob out and they just come loose. Push in and turn to tighten. I love these things
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Nice fitting weight shoes. Would suggest
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. I used a block previously for squats, and even though I was supported, I still didn't feel stable. These filled every gap in that. They are comfortable and fit snugly (which I like.) I feel like I have balance and support when squatting, and even reach a little deeper than normal when warmed up. The only real negative I have is that I'm not used to how Adidas fit, since I haven't owned any in years, so my feet hurt sometimes, but that isn't a negative on the product.
customer_reviews.author: Derek V.

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit perfect! I bought and tried the 12 and a half's and they were definitely too big. The only downside of the shoes is they are not comfortable to walk in or do any other workouts in. They really are fantastic for deadlifting and squatting and that is all. I have zero complaints except for the fact that they are uncomfortable and awkward to walk in.
customer_reviews.author: Crisanto De La Montez

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: I am experiencing much greater stability when squatting in this shoe. I feel rock solid in my stance. I am experiencing much greater glute and hamstring engagement while squatting. This is because my squatting range of motion is now considerably greater. I also feel my lower back is in a much better position while using this shoe. This shoe seems very well constructed and should prove to be very durable. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Not just for men! Great shoes for women who need to perfect their squat!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes for squats! I wear a women’s size 9.5 and ordered a men’s size 8 and they fit perfectly. I love the tightening mechanism and the shoes really do their job in helping me get into a lower squat position. Highly recommended for women too!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Helmuth

customer_reviews.title: Hottness
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I very much like these. They are stable and relatively light weight. I'm a fan of the boa + laces; I never liked Velcro style. They run very hot though. I usually have to open them between sets. The arch also isn't perfect for my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: I had the Adipower lifters before and they are hard to find now, so I wanted something similar. These are great! Lots of padding for a comfortable fit, the sole is solid and stable. The balance you get from them doing full squat snatches is great. The weight is a little lighter than the Nike lifters I have. I'll be using these for the nation comp. I have coming up. But I would definitely recommend these for anyone looking for a great lifting shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Shanw M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Does the perfect lifting shoe exist? If it does, this is it. The lace system works the way it's supposed to and the elevation is perfect (at least for me). If you have subpar ankle mobility, you won't be disappointed in this shoe's ability to get you where you need to be with your form. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Page

customer_reviews.title: The White is not built to last
customer_reviews.text: The boa system does not work in this shoe so if you have a narrow foot and are buying for this feature- go with the Iniv8 Fadt lifts. Also, I ordered 3 different colors in this shoe and the White was the only one with flimsy construction, material. Not built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Was going to get the red ones, because they look awesome, but the price killed me. Therefore I got the blue ones, and I was satisfied. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Read reviews about sizing before ordering
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 14 and this shoe is EXACTLY a 14 & leaves little to no room in the toe box. If you have wider feet I would recommend ordering a size larger. Performance of shoe is 5 stars. Feet feel secured and grounded allowing for more power out of the bottom. And you I’ll have no problem hitting depth with these. (Coming from a person who stood on a thinner wood board to elevate heels in order to squat) Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Michael Poindexter

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable to wear. Looks so nice.
customer_reviews.text: Switched from Adipowers, was worried that the new heel height would make all lifts feel like it's the first time doing em but no, i adapted quite nicely. Although, I've been going light since i got the pair. But they feel comfortable. I didn't need any time to adjust. I also realized that i had my Adipowers half a size too big at 8 (no point of comparison since it was my first lifting shoe). I made a bet that 7.5s would fit me better, and they did! Happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: alay magno

customer_reviews.title: Great squat show
customer_reviews.text: Fit was great. I am 6ft 2. And use a high squat helps me a lot. Love them
customer_reviews.author: Peter Romine

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Choice
customer_reviews.text: Bought this show "like new" and the condition of them is better than I even expected. These have clearly not been lifted with very much if at all before I got them. Tried them out today and they're a great show. The twist tighten system is awesome and reminds me of a well fitted pair a ski boots. Hug the feet tight, without being too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Jammirat

customer_reviews.title: Great for Olympic weightlifting.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these lifters! At first they were a little tight. Once they get broken in they fit like a glove. I went with a half size smaller. Glad I did my foot doesn’t move around inside the shoe. Great for Olympic lifting. I recommend these shoes for anyone looking for a 1” heel lift.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier G.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic oly lifting shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking to buy some higher quality oly lifting shoes for a few years. I've been using some cheap ones I've had for years. These fit the bill and the 1 inch heal helps with my crappy ankle dorsiflexion. The boa system takes some getting used to but now I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Keller

customer_reviews.title: I'm an Adidas Leistung wearer for life now!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Love the fit and look of the shoe. Very sturdy and the boa straps ensure a snug, secure fit. I wear a size 11 Women's, but ordered the 10 in Men's because I have a wider foot. This was a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Kamanneck

customer_reviews.title: Useless Boa Laces
customer_reviews.text: Having boa laces on this was completely useless since you still have to lace up the top as well. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more Velcro!
customer_reviews.text: The best shoe for lifting. I wish they made a flat or zero lift version too. I could have gone a .5 size down. Maybe even a whole size. But then they would probably be too tight. Quick on and off, and solid for all heavy lifts.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for lifting!
customer_reviews.text: These are really great for the intermediate to experienced weight lifter. They have a sturdy and supportive construction and the latest technology with the BOA system in place of the normal velcro strap. I was very pleased with the fit being accurate to size. I recommend these shoes for sure.
customer_reviews.author: alberto barron

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These trainers are not only good looking, they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: M. Delicio

customer_reviews.title: Get better squat depth!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. I'm so glad I finally decided to get these to help me with my squats
customer_reviews.author: jjhicks2000

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and good grip!
customer_reviews.text: They are extremely comfortable and I love that the heel is higher than the regular lifters. Works amazing for someone like me who cannot get deep into squats because of poor mobility! I definitely recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie G.

customer_reviews.title: BOA better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about the boa system based on YouTube reviews, BUT I really like it. It feels better than a strap; more even pressure. If you have a wide foot you may want to look for another shoe
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s a good one
customer_reviews.text: They fit exactly as I expected and the mesh is extremely comfortable I’m weary of the boa mechanism I feel like it will snap after a few months of use but so far they are great. I can hit full atg squats in these and they improve your form
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected, I ordered men’s size 5 since I am a women’s size 6.5 also reasonably priced
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Hatley

customer_reviews.title: Great for Olympic weightlifting
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for Olympic weightlifting, lots of people don’t like the Boa system but it’s worked well for me so far, shoes stay tight the whole workout. Overall great shoes make squats feel much better.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Lombardo

customer_reviews.title: Great lifting shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes used them for a month great support only took 3 days to break in
customer_reviews.author: Chuck T

customer_reviews.title: These lifters work for me
customer_reviews.text: I love the shoes they are very solid. The BOA system does come a little bit loose at times but when I rest I just tighten them back up not really an issue. I do recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Adidas Leistung
customer_reviews.text: They are perfect! And for a narrow foot they’re true to size.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Changed the way I lift
customer_reviews.text: Im a very tall lifter and needed something to accommodate my long femurs. These shoes have helped me get into a deep receiving position with no problems at all
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed Ali

customer_reviews.title: Great lifters
customer_reviews.text: Really like the shoe. The wire-button is awesome and looks way better than the velcro straps that every other lifter has.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for a great price
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great. They offer great support and stability. The boa tightening system works very well too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable weight lifting shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughter who does competitive weight lifting and she absolutely loves them. She says they are comfortable, she has a wide foot.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Musty

customer_reviews.title: BF's Favorite Lifting Shoe
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend loves them. He says they fit perfectly and are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: Shoe fits well and I like the extra 1/4” of lift. The boa system seems like a good idea but you can’t get them as snug as you can straps.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought these sneakers for my son and he loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene I.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely satisfied with seller and product!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes! Seller was awesome and so was product! Fast delivery!
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: narrow feet
customer_reviews.text: Good shoes but narrow feet and worried about BOA system failure
customer_reviews.author: won seok

product_meta.title: adidas Mens Leistung.16 Ii
product_meta.description: These men's weightlifting shoes build on the medal-worthy performances of the past to deliver modern technology and a contemporary design. They're built with a wide platform and heel lift to maximize stability. The micro-adjustable Boa Closure System dials in a secure fit.
feature_bullets: Flat, flexible forefoot for the transmission of power
Rearfoot cradle ensures superior lockdown stability
Micro-adjusting Boa Closure System for ultimate, consistent hold
Strong TPU midsole for a perfect foothold; Weight lifting-engineered chassis with lightweight injected polymer for structured strength
